text.content:
Inpatient Note 
 
     ==============================================================
  CHIEF COMPLAINT(s):  Pylonephritis.  Feeling much better over last 48 hours. 
 
  PRESENT ILLNESS:
The patient no longer has nausea or vomiting since yesterday; no fever since 
5/31; no more dysuria or urgency.  Per am CBC - ready for Discharge on PO abx. 
 
Computer is the source for the following medication list:
 
Active Inpatient Medications (excluding Supplies):
 
     Active Inpatient Medications                           Status
 
=========================================================================
1)   AMPICILLIN/SULBACTAM INJ AMPICILLIN/SULBACTAM 1.5 GM   ACTIVE
       in DEXTROSE 5% IN WATER 50 ML  INFUSE OVER 15
       MINUTES IVP Q6H
2)   CHLORTHALIDONE TAB  12.5 MG PO QDAY                    ACTIVE
3)   DEXT 5% NACL 0.9% INJ,SOLN in DEXTROSE 5%/0.9% SOD     ACTIVE
       CHLORIDE 1000 ML  75 ml/hr IV
4)   ERGOCALCIFEROL CAP,ORAL  1000 UNITS PO QDAY            ACTIVE
5)   GLYBURIDE TAB  2.5MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
6)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) TAB  0.125MG PO QDAY      ACTIVE
7)   LISINOPRIL TAB  20MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
8)   SIMVASTATIN TAB  80MG PO QPM                           ACTIVE
9)   VENLAFAXINE TAB  75MG PO BID                           ACTIVE
 
 
  PHYSICAL EXAM:
VITAL SIGNS:
            B/P:  146/74 (06/02/2012 07:35)
          Pulse:  73 (06/02/2012 07:35)
    Temperature:  99.1 F [37.3 C] (06/02/2012 07:35)
   Respirations:  12 (06/02/2012 07:35)
         Weight:  241 lb [109.5 kg] (05/30/2012 13:30)
         Height:  64 in [162.6 cm] (11/20/2011 11:10)
            BMI:  41
           Pain:  0 (06/02/2012 07:35)
 
EXAM:
GEN: NAD, Obese female
NECK: absence of thyroid noted; no lymphadenopathy noted
HEART: RRR no M/R/G
LUNGS: CTAB no W/R/R
ABD: obese, NT, ND
BACK: no CVA tenderness
EXT: no LE edema
NEURO: patellar DTRs are normal bilaterally
PSYCH: normal mood and behavior
 
  ==============================================================
LABS: 
06/02/12  6:45    GLUCOSE              104
06/02/12  6:45    UREA NITROGEN        32H
06/02/12  6:45    CREATININE           1.3
06/02/12  6:45    SODIUM               139
06/02/12  6:45    POTASSIUM            4.1
06/02/12  6:45    CHLORIDE             102
06/02/12  6:45    CO2                  29
06/02/12  6:45    WBC                  8.1
06/02/12  6:45    RBC                  4.2
06/02/12  6:45    HGB                  14.2
06/02/12  6:45    HCT                  42.6
06/02/12  6:45    MCV                  84.2
06/02/12  6:45    MCH                  28.2
06/02/12  6:45    MCHC                 34.6
06/02/12  6:45    RDW                  13
06/02/12  6:45    PLATELET COUNT       142
06/02/12  6:45    MPV                  7.5 
 
  ==============================================================
  ASSESSMENT AND CARE PLAN:
 
55  year old female with a pmh of   DM2, HTN , hyperlipidemia currently admitted 
with Pseudomonas Pyelonephritis.
1.      Pyelonephritis: doing better, change to oral ciprofloxacin.
2.      DM2: continue glyburide.
3.      HTN: continue lisinopril and chlorthalidone; BP fine.
4.      Disposition: will d/c later today
5.      Follow up: PCP as needed
